meanings.definition: To convey or communicate quickly and efficiently.
meanings.sent1: She superexpresses her ideas clearly in meetings.
meanings.sent2: The email superexpresses the urgency of the situation.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel superexpresses its excitement for the upcoming acorn festival.
meanings.sent4: His smile superexpresses his gratitude better than words.
meanings.sent5: The emergency broadcast superexpresses the need for immediate action.

meanings.definition: A high-speed train or transportation service.
meanings.sent1: The superexpresses arrived at the station right on time.
meanings.sent2: I prefer taking the superexpresses for long journeys.
meanings.sent3: The superexpresses are like rockets on rails, zooming past the countryside.
meanings.sent4: The superexpresses are the cheetahs of the railway world.
meanings.sent5: The superexpresses make other trains seem slow in comparison.
